page.title: 08ANNUAL EVENTS AND TRADITIONS
page.content: The Dressing of the Wells is a procession of children carrying letters spelling the name of the day - "Ascension". The wooden structures are covered with moss and then garden flowers. In earlier days wild flowers were used. The afternoon begins with a church service. Afterwards comes a procession through the streets,headed by the children carrying the decorated letters. Next comes the vicar and crucifer more children carrying posies and then a silver band. At the Wells thanks are given for the gift of water. A tea for all the village children follows and later sports on the playfield are enjoyed by everyone. A recent annual event, now two years old, is a Fun Run. It is a half marathon undertaken either by running or cycling. Much of it is over steep hills around the area.
